title: Last leaves;
author: Smith, Alexander
snippet: • It is a pity to spoil a point for a critic who may chance to be in want of one ; but I am really not here implying that Smith was as great a genius as Bums, any more than that Lord Daer- an amiable person, but never specially considered bright-had he lived into this age of Science, could have written the "Reign of Law."

title: Last leaves;
author: Smith, Alexander
snippet: It seemed then for Burns a great honour doubtless  ; to day it almost seems as if for Lord Daer, of the two, the honour was distinctly the greater.

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Inclosing him the extempore verses on dining ivith lord Daer.

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Lord Daer was only 31 years of age when he died.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: One rank as ■weel's another ; Nae honest worthy man need care To meet with noble youthful Daer,

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: But they met with a barbarian who was not at all barbarous : as the poet met in Lord Daer feelings  and sentiments as natural as those of a ploughman, so they met in a ploughman manners worthy of a lord: his air was easy and unperplexed: his address was perfectly well-bred, and elegant in its simplicity : he felt neither eclipsed by the titled nor struck dumb before the
